Level 0.Description:
These are simple utility magic that don't usually have much impact on the game.
All of these items can be sold to a merchant for 50% of the standard price.

Pot of Boiling.Effect: The inside of this pot is hot enough to boil water, while the outside is at room temperature.
Pot of Boiling.Notes: This pot proves the inside is more important than the outside.

Earring of the Plains.Effect: You can eat any plant, poisonous or not, without being poisoned, and it tastes good.
Earring of the Plains.Notes: Plants start tasting umami with a pinch of salt and corriander.

Box of Peas.Effect: Once per Adventure, when you open this box, it produces 1d100 Peas.

Patch of Beards.Effect: Your beard grows 5 times as fast, if you can grow a beard.

Everice Shard.Effect: This ice shard never melts, and always maintains its volume and temperature.

Flask of Scents.Effect: Open the lid to capture a scent. The next time you open it, it will produce that smell indefinitely.
Flask of Scents.Notes: Capturing a scent is done at will.

Air Quill.Effect: A quill with infinite ink that can write on air at will. The ink can stay there up to 24 hours.

Level 1 Utility Items.Description:
These items are useful in certain scenarios and might even have a combat use. Feel free to give players any number of Utility Items. These items will lose their magical properties if they break (e.g. break into 2 pieces).
All of these items can be sold to a merchant for 50% of the standard price.

Endless Pitcher.Effect: While opened, produces 1 liter of clean water per turn (every 6 seconds).

Jar of Preserving.Effect: Things sealed inside the jar don't age (e.g. food, poison, insects, etc).

Jug of Filling.Effect: Inbetween Adventures, this Jug fills with {Liquid} of average quality.

Amulet of Hope.Effect: Illuminates 3 meters around you when worn, without blinding, and, if indoors, the light points to the nearest exit from the dungeon/house/etc.
Amulet of Hope.Notes: You can touch it at will to activate or deactivate the lights.

Steel Silk Rope.Effect: On command (0 Actions), turns from silk to steel and back.

Torchstone.Effect: Levitates around you (up to 3 meters away) and shines light in a 5 meter radius.

Everdress.Effect: Set of common female clothes that, at will, instantly cleans itself or repairs tears.
Everdress.Notes: The effect does clean acid, paint, etc.

Telegraphic Paper Sheet.Effect: Hold this sheet of papare while thinking of a person you know. Say that person's name, and the paper will teleport to that person's pocket.

Bottle of Eversmoke.Effect: At will, can be used to create 1 cubic meter of smoke, of any color.
Bottle of Eversmoke.Notes: Using items always uses a Half-Action.

Conch of Sand.Effect: At will, can be used to create a 50x50x50 centimeter cube of sand.
Conch of Sand.Notes: Using items always uses a Half-Action.

Sack of Traps.Effect: Use this Sack to deploy a stack of {Trap} of normal quality in a 1-meter area.

Spyglass.Effect: Using this Spyglass provides a +5 to Sense Checks for Sight at at distance beyond 50 meters.

Scabbard of Fingers.Effect: You can freely swap weapons during your turn (except Shields) and halves the time it takes to don/doff armor.

Dwarven Salve.Effect: Applied to skin, makes hair grow overnight.

Book of Memories.Effect: People can willingly inscribe memories as images in this book - they are accurate to what the person remembers.

Strap of Returning.Effect: 3 items can be attuned - they will fly back to you at the end of your turn if within 25 meters and there's an available path.

Ring of the Coin.Effect: Coins become stored in the ring (and expelled at will). Can hold up to 5000 gold in coins.

Band of Sustenance.Effect: The time you need to sleep is halved.

Casette of Voices.Effect: It records sounds, up to 10 minutes. You can spend 5 minutes to reset it.

Purifying Stone.Effect: Purifies water you put it in, removing microbes, impurities and poisons.

Level 2 Utility Consumables.Description: These are standard consumables. Award players with one these every now and then.

Seed of Freezing.Effect: A small seed, wrapped in silk. It melts upon touching a liquid, and instantly freezes a 2x2 meter part of it.

Storm Vial.Effect: The vial holds a small storm inside. When released, it creates a thunderstorm on a 5x5 meter area. Units inside wearing Metal take 1d4 Shock Damage at the start of their turn, and the area counts as Fog.

Superglue.Effect: A small-sized vial of super glue.

Level 2 Consumables.Description:
These are standard consumables. Award players with one these every now and then. It is also recommended you provide these in limited supply at shops (e.g. if your Adventure is medium difficulty, do not provide more than 2 Potions per Adventure).
Remember that items always take a Half-Action to use, and a Potion consumer risks an Overdose if 2 Potions are consumed within 1 hour. Special ammo does not need a Half-Action to be loaded - a Player can simply state that they are using that ammo for an attack.
All of these items can be sold to a merchant for 50% of the standard price.

Sharp Vapors.Effect: When blown towards a Unit within 5 meters, clears all Crowd Control on that Unit.

Spell Flare.Effect: Throw in an 3x3 area. All Units caught in the flare's explosion are dispelled of all magical effects affecting them (including Crowd Control from a magic source).

Elemental Oil.Effect: Apply to a melee weapon. Attacks with that weapon deal +1 Damage and all the Damage is converted to {Element}.

Spectral Ammo.Effect: Curves around obstacles and attacks with it do not require Line of Sight (but there must be an available path the missile can take).
Spectral Ammo.Pre: Feel free to reward the Players with multiple of these.

Healing Ammo.Effect: When shot from a weapon, heals the target for 2d6 instead of dealing Damage.

Arrow of Slaying.Effect: Adds 1d6 extra Damage when shot against a {Type}. Can be used with any ranged weapon that requires ammo.

Elixir of Growth.Effect: Increases your size by 1 tier and gives you 5 Shielding for up to 1 hour.

Seed of Flames.Effect: It explodes upon touching something flamable, dealing 3d6 Fire Damage in a 3x3 meter area.

Bottle of Light Absorbtion.Effect: Absorbs all light around when unbottled and creates Magical Darkness in a 5x5 area.

Ring of Good Omen.Effect: If you fail a Check, you can shatter the ring to instantly succeed it.

Level 2 Utility Items.Description:
These are utility magic items that will help your party in non-combat endeavors. These magical items will not break puzzles or challenges, but will provide extra options to make them more approachable.
All of these items can be sold to a merchant for 50% of the standard price.
Equippable items become Soulclaimed when equipped, for the rest of the Adventure. A Soulclaimed item has its effect only for the wearer.

Folding Boat.Effect: When deployed, the boat immediately and magically expands into a boat of a regular size. Tapping the boat 5 times folds the boat back into its folded form.

Sending Stones.Effect: A pair of magical stones. Someone can talk into one of the stones, and the other stone will emmit the message in real time.

Bag of Useful Items.Effect: Think of an item you need from the Adventurer Gear of General Goods lists. When putting your had in the bag, make a Luck Check. If you roll 6 or more, you pull out the item you needed. Otherwise, you pull out a random, useless item.

Leaf of Mountain Speak.Effect: Ask a piece of rock or mountain a question. It can answer with sounds it "heard", or project an image of what it "saw". The older the sound or image, the blurrier or noisier the answer is.

Mask of Eyes.Effect: No slots for eyes, but you can see from above yourself, as if you looked at the battle map.

Immovable Needle.Effect: A needle that becomes immovable when its keyword is uttered. It becomes unmoving in its place, even levitating, with 250 kilograms of force.

Ring of Strange Escape.Effect: Roll 1d8 and 1d10. You get teleported depending on your rolls. The 1d8 represents a direction (North, North-East, East, South-East, etc). The 1d10 represents the distance in meters. One use per day.

Omnirod.Effect: Transforms at will into a rope, sack, crowbar, bucket or similar useful items.

Staff of Adaptation.Effect: At will, you can increase or decrease the weight of the staff by 50kg, shrink it or increase it in size from 20% to 500% in any dimension (lengthen, increase girth, flatten, etc) or make it levitate in place as if pushed by 100kg of force from all directions.

Shirt of Many Aspects.Effect: Can change what your clothing looks like at will.

Branch of Woodshaping.Effect: Touch a Large or smaller piece of wood with this branch to roughly alter its shape to your willing. Once per Adventure.

Orb of Oversight.Effect: On use, it reveals the area within 10 meters (e.g. through darkness, or behind medium obstacles). It does not reveal through walls or doors, though.

Headband of Mind Speak.Effect: Other Units can attune to the headband for 1 hour. They can send thoughts directly to your mind.

Coin of Odds.Effect: When doing a Check, instead of rolling a die, flip a coin. Heads counts as 15, tails counts as 0.

Level 3 Utility Equipment.Description: These are simple utility magic items that are equipped onto characters, and won't usually affect combat very much.

Variants.E: The wearer takes no falling Damage, and instead falls slowly.
Variants.Name: Slow Falling

Variants.E: The wearer has a swimming Speed of 6 meters.
Variants.Name: Fins

Variants.E: You are immune to Fumbling and have +2 to Dexterity Checks for balancing.
Variants.Name: Balance

Nightvision Goggles.Effect: Wearer can see up to 5 meters in Darkness without having Cover.

Variants.E: Inscribe on a weapon to permanently increase its Damage by 1.
Variants.Name: Damage Rune

Variants.E: Inscribe on a weapon to permanently increase its Damage by 2. Only usable on weapons that originally have no Stat requirement.
Variants.Name: Reinforcement Rune

Variants.E: +1 Speed. Wearing these boots, you are immune to hard terrain and your legs don't tire from walking.
Variants.Name: Tirelessness

Variants.E: Your minimum speed is 5 and unaffected by armor's Speed reduction if any.
Variants.Name: Striding

Variants.E: Immune to Hard Terrain, being Blinded, and are unaffected by darkness penalties (Cover).
Variants.Name: Tremor Sense

Variants.E: You are immune to being Pushed and have +1 to all Might Checks.
Variants.Name: Grounding

Variants.E: Your Ambush bonus is +10 instead of +5.
Variants.Name: Ambushing

Variants.E: Enemy Ambush bonus is +3 instead of +5.
Variants.Name: Steadyfoot

Leggings of Freedom.Effect: You are immune to being Rooted and Slowed.
Leggings of Freedom.Notes: Can be worn with any armor.

Javelin of Accuracy.Effect: A normal Pike, but once per Adventure, it can be thrown without penalties and without needing Training, and it ignores Cover.

Holy Weapon.Effect: Deals {Damage} extra Damage to Undeads and Demons.

Pulse Weapon.Effect: Deals {Damage} extra Damage to non-biological Units and the Damage type becomes Pulse.

Dryad Weapon.Effect: Deals {Damage} extra Damage to Beasts and Fiends ad the Damage type becomes Poison.

Bracer of Archery.Effect: The minimum attack bonus with ranged weapons becomes +3 (if any).

Shield of Arrows.Effect: Acts as a normal Shield that also provides +1 Defense against arrows and bolts.

Charm of Alter Word.Effect: When someone casts a Spell, you can change one letter in the Spell's name to give it a different meaning. The effect is determined by the DM, but the DM must take the intention into account. You always know the name of a Spell when it is cast.

Variants.E: After every Worthy Combat, you regain 1d4 Health. Only works if the wearer is religious.
Variants.Name: Blessed Ring of Protection

Variants.E: While wearing this Ring, your body is withering and you have -1 Might, but you have +1 Movement.
Variants.Name: Ring of Withering

Variants.E: 50% Fire Resistance. When you get to 0 Health, you are instantly revived to 1 Health without Exhaustion. Then the ring breaks.
Variants.Name: Ring of the Phoenix

Ring of the Eldritch Thing.Effect: Summon a wyrd tentacle at a place within 10 meters. It takes its turn after you and can make one attack for 1d8 Damage, 2 meters range. It tries to attack your party, but will attack anything as long as it has range. It has 10 Health and 0 Defense.

Zephyr Scarf.Effect: 50% Pulse Resistance. When activated, make your body weigh 1kg for up to 1 minute.

Charm of Truestrike.Effect: Your next weapon or Spell attack applies a Critical Strike if it has any, regardless of what you roll, and ignores the target's Resistances, if any.

Level 4 Utility Items.Description: These are simple utility magic that don't usually have much impact on the game.

Ring of the Spies.Effect: Putting this ring against a solid wall or door will reveal the other side, as if it were a door visor. Only works on walls less than 1 foot thick.

Immovable Rod.Effect: A 1-meter long metal rod that becomes immovable when its keyword is uttered. It becomes unmoving in its place, even levitating, with 1 ton of force.

Bag of Holding.Effect: Contains 2x2x2 meters of space inside, as if it were a pocket-dimension. The bag's content's weight increases the bag's weight.

Hourglass of Slowing.Effect: On use, all enemies you can see are Slowed.

Mask of Reflection.Effect: People looking at it see themselves.

Bracer of the Phantom.Effect: Once per Adventure, your arm becomes spectral and can pass through anything. You can choose to make parts of your arm physical such as to manipulate ites on the other side of a wall.

Pestle of Absorption.Effect: You can easily destroy any material that you put inside this mortar and pestle, and turn it into fine dust. Destroying a magic item creates a special poweder. When snorting all of it, the consumer has 90% chance to gain +1 Health, and 10% chance to gain an Affliction.

Skull of Personalities.Effect: Once per Adventure, you can put the skull eye-to-eye to another person (dead or alive). The skull can then talk and act like that person, with its personality, but has no memories of that dead person.

Demon Box.Effect: An unknown box that has a demon inside. Conversing with it will make the wearer lose something and gain a random Basic Ability. The demon haunts the players as long as they carry the box.

Ring of Youth.Effect: While wearing this ring, you age backwards (become younger as time goes on). The ring melds with the wearer, and can only be removed by cutting off the finger.

Wand of Plenty.Effect: Once per Adventure, touch a _lootable_ object that contains unknown _worthy_ items inside. Increase the loot reward by 25%.
Wand of Plenty.Notes: It is up to the QM to increase the loot reward and items inside. Trust the Quest Master!

Level 5 Consumables.Description: These are simple utility magic that don't usually have much impact on the game.

Fortress Seed.Effect: Planting this seed in fertile soil starts building a fortress over 5 minutes.

Ball of Imprisonment.Effect: Throw at a non-Epic Unit. It makes a Check of its will with +1 for every 10% Health it has. If it fails, it becomes instantly trapped inside the ball.
Ball of Imprisonment.Upgrade: The inside of the ball is spherical 3-meter diameter room. You can release the Unit using a Half-Action to tap on the ball.

Potion of Invulnerability.Effect: Become immune to taking Damage until the start of your next turn.

Tome of Stat.Upgrade: Upon opening this sealed tome, the words start swirling, exiting the tome and being absorbed, physically and mentally, by the reader. Then, the tome loses its power and becomes a standard blank book.

Ammo of Effect.Effect: Using a Half-Action, load onto a ranged weapon. {Effect}.

Variants.Effect: The next shot also deals 1d12 Fire Damage to the target and all Units within 1 meter of it
The next shot also deals 1d12 Shock Damage to the target, then to the closes Unit to it, and again to the closest Unit to that Unit
The next shot makes the target Feared
The next shot makes the target Crippled
The next shot makes the target Stunned
The next shot makes the target +50% Damage from Fire, Shock and Cold until the start of your next turn.

Level 5 Equipment.Description: These are simple utility magic that don't usually have much impact on the game.

Ring of Stat.Effect: You have +1 {Stat} (up to your Level's limit).

Wand +1.Effect: All your Spells that deal Damage deal an extra +1 Damage.

Cloak of Vanishing.Effect: When someone declares an attack on you, you can use your Reaction to Flash 6 meters away.

Belt of Reflex.Effect: You always dodge (take 0 Damage) the first attack from a Unit at the start of each Adventure (requires attuning)

Shield of Reflection.Effect: Instead of taking Damage from an attack after the roll, reflect it back to the attacker.

Shield of Snakes.Effect: +1 Defense vs Ranged; if you take 3 or less Damage from a melee attack, deals 1d6 Poison Damage back to the attacker.

Ring of Spell Storage.Effect:
Spend the Mana Cost and Cooldown (if any) for any Ability, and store it inside this ring.
Using a Half-Action, expend the Ability inside to cast it.
Ring of Spell Storage.Upgrade: The ring can only hold 1 Ability at a time.

Boots of Water Walking.Effect: The wearer can walk on water.

Medallion of Water.Effect: Instantly transform into a puddle of water and avoid any Damage that would make sense to avoid (e.g. arrows or slashes might be avoided, but not rocks falling over you or being hit with Area Abilities). Lasts up to 1 minute, but you can end the effect early using a Half-Action.

Blood Bracer.Effect: You deal and take 50% more Damage.
Blood Bracer.Upgrade: Once equipped, this bracer pins itself on your wrist. It takes 1 hour to remove, and upon removal, the wearer takes 1d10 Pierce Damage.

Blood Choker.Effect: Your Max Health decreases by 50%, but your Health Regen is doubled.
Blood Choker.Upgrade: Once equipped, this choker pins itself on your neck. it takes 1 hour to remove, and upon removal, the wearer takes 1d10 Pierce Damage.

Eye of the Warlock.Effect: Your Max Mana is reduced by 66% (rounded up). All of your Mana regenerates 10 minutes after each Worthy combat encounter (e.g. instead of inbetween Adventures).
Eye of the Warlock.Upgrade: When moved close to one of your eyes, this glowing ball attaches itself to your eye and replaces it with this. The eye can only be removed by a spell that removes curses, and upon removal, the wearer takes 1d10 Scourge Damage.

Stone Gauntlets.Effect: You can no longer spend Many by any means. Your melee 2-Handed attacks deal extra Damage equal to your Max Mana.
Stone Gauntlets.Upgrade:
When equipped, these gloves meld onto the skin and transforms the wearers hands into larger stone-like appendiges that can be moved, but feel no pain or sensations.
Can only be removed with a spell that dispels magic effects.

Level 6 Consumables.Description: These are simple utility magic that don't usually have much impact on the game.

Level 7 Utility Items.Description: These are simple utility magic that don't usually have much impact on the game.

Level 7 Equipment.Description: These are simple utility magic that don't usually have much impact on the game.

Hand Axe of the North.Effect: +1d4 Cold; On Critical Strike, target must succeed a Might Check against 10 or be Rooted. Works when thrown. On your turn, you can spend half of your Movement to have the Axe dash safely to your hand if within 10 meters.

Dragonhand.Effect: +1d4 Fire; On Critical Strike, deal 1d4 more Fire Damage.

Rapier of Shadows.Effect: +1d4 Scourge; If you roll maximum on the die against a Worthy Enemy, you become invisible for 1 turn

Dancer Blade.Effect: +1d4; once per day, you can choose to dodge an attack (when it is declared) and instantly counterattack (takes a Reaction)

Dagger of the Ink.Effect: +1d4; becomes a tattoo or a weapon at will; has 2 meters range

Chainblade of Chaos.Effect: +1d4; 2 meters range; the extra 1d4 is always direct Damage in an area around you (2m)

Cleaver of Berserking.Effect: +1d4; every consecutive attack with this in a turn deals +1d4 more Damage than the previous

Sickle of Blood.Effect: +1d4; Once per Adventure, for 0 Actions, make your next attack have 3 meters range, deal 1d4 extra Damage and you heal for all the weapon Damage dealt (after Defense)

Pike of Ages.Effect: +1d8; On command, the pike rapidly expands to up to 10 meters. Your attacks with it now have that range. Lasts for 2 turns. 1 use per day

Scythe of Reaping.Effect: +2d4; When killing a Worthy Enemy with it, store 1d4 (up to 10d4). When you attack, you can choose to release any number of the stored

Greatsword of the Moon.Effect: +2; Once per Adventure, you can activate it for 0 Actions and make its every attack also cast a basic version of Magic Missiles on any other Unit within 6 meters of the main target. Lasts for 10 minutes.

Musket of Whispers.Effect: +2d4 Pulse; makes no sound; you have Hide and always start combat Hidden, regardless of Cover

Technical Ballista.Effect: +2d4; Target is pushed back 1 meter for each 4 rolled. If it collides with something, it takes 1d4 extra Damage

The Quickfire.Effect: +1d4; the Crossbow shoots magical arrows and does not need to be reloaded

Adamantite Armor.Effect: Defense equal to your Might. Your attacks beyond 3 meters range have -2 Penalty.

Items.Effect: Gain 1 Feat without paying the cost.

Situational Items.Description: These are simple utility magic that don't usually have much impact on the game.

Ring of Petrification (L2U).Effect: Putting this ring on will instantly turn the person to stone if it has less than 3 Intelligence. Removing the ring reverts the effect.
